humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest focus of invasion of the invasive lobular carcinoma is 7.0 cm, which exceeds the maximum size for T1 (2 cm) and T2 (5 cm) tumors. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the largest focus of invasion of the invasive lobular carcinoma is measured to be 7.0 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T3 stage is assigned to tumors that are larger than 50 mm in greatest dimension. Therefore, the patient's cancer is classified as T3.
